titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Ferdinand Peroutka papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Martina Podsklanova

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-10-18T13:37-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Removed biographical note from Hoover website and kept biographical chron list.
Copied biographical information from Hoover website.
Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated.

did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, writings, and printed matter, relating to postwar conditions in Czechoslovakia, the internal administration of Radio Free Europe, and Czechoslovak émigré politics.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of all sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ferdinand Peroutka papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1984.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Ladislav Feierabend papers, Hoover Institution Archives
Michal Múdry papers, Hoover Institution Archives
Radio Free Europe broadcast records, Hoover Institution Archives
Radio Free Europe corporate records, Hoover Institution Archives
Jaroslav Stránský papers, Hoover Institution Archives
Josef Škvorecký papers, Hoover Institution Archives

eventgrp.event: Co-founder and Editor-in-Chief, the weekly Přítomnost (founded with support from President Tomáš Garrigue Masaryk, and with Karel Čapek and other prominent writers as regular contributors)

chronitem.event: Author, Budování státu, a multiple-volume monograph
Imprisoned, Dachau and Buchenwald concentration camps

eventgrp.event: Author, Oblak a valčík: kolektivní drama o dvanácti obrazech
Immigrated to London, Great Britain; published in émigré periodicals throughout his career (Hlas domova, Americké listy, České slovo, and others)

chronitem.event: Member, Rada svobodného Československa (The Council of Free Czechoslovakia)
Editor-in-Chief, Radio Free Europe Czechoslovak Desk
Author, weekly broadcast addresses in Radio Free Europe (published as a three-volume monograph Mluví k vám Ferdinand Peroutka: rozhlasové komentáře rádia Svobodná Evropa, 2003-2006)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence with prominent Czechoslovak cultural and political figures in Czechoslovakia and in exile, and with American intellectual elites, as well as Peroutka's writings in exile. Also included are correspondence and internal documents of Radio Free Europe and the Council of Free Czechoslovakia (Rada svobodného Československa). Transcripts of Peroutka's radio addresses and sound recordings of Radio Free Europe programs form the final and most extensive part of the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence with prominent Czechoslovak cultural and political figures in Czechoslovakia and in exile, with American intellectual elites, letters related to Radio Free Europe and to Peroutka's writings, as well as other correspondence. Arranged alphabetically and then chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a report on the public image of Edvard Beneš in post-war Czechoslovakia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter with questions on Milena Jesenská

did.unittitle: Československý poradní sbor v západní Evropě (Czechoslovak Advisory Committee in Western Europe),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a report on Peroutka's view of the Sudeten-German question

did.unittitle: Feldstein, Petr, Student: Týdeník československého svazu mládeže,
Hájek, H.J., Skutečnost: Independent Review in Czech and Slovak,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes his personal recollections of World War II, including his imprisonment by the Gestapo, and a letter from his family on his passing

did.unittitle: Hladík, J., Československá obec legionářská v exilu - Francie,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a report on behalf of Hostovský to John Richardson, Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a report on a meeting with Erich von Manstein

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter on the situation in Czechoslovakia after the Prague Spring events, and a photograph of the National Museum in Prague

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also contains letters by Jaroslav Pecháček

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a report on a conversation with Pachman, then a recent émigré, on general conditions in Czechoslovakia and on the regime's treatment of anti-government politicians after the Prague Spring

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter signed by Petr Z. [Zenkl?]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also contains letters to Petr Zenkl

did.unittitle: Společnost pro vědy a umění (Czechoslovak Society of Arts and Sciences in America),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a letter from Slávka Peroutková to Míla and Eva, and a letter from Míla

did.unittitle: Zich, Jaroslav V., ú střední svaz československého studentstva v exilu,
Official letters from Moscow by Klement Gottwald and Zdeněk Fierlinger, typescripts,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains writings by or about Peroutka, including typescripts of his essays, plays, and other writings, reviews of his writings and related documents, newspaper clippings including caricatures of him in the Czechoslovak domestic press, interviews, and materials related to his passing in 1978. Arranged by subject.

did.unittitle: Rozhovor mezi p. Simonem, představitelem dra. Lodgmana, a p. Peroutkou and Interview of Mr. Simon, Representative of Dr. Lodgman, with Mr. Peroutka,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a handwritten record of the conversation on the Sudeten-German question and an English translation in typescript

did.unittitle: Cartoons on or caricatures of Peroutka and Radio Free Europe in the Soviet bloc press,
Reviews, comments, newspaper clippings and related materials on Peroutka's book Democratic Manifesto,
Byl Beneš vinen?, pamphlet, and its translation Was Eduard Beneš guilty?, typescript,
Obituaries, telegrams, newspaper clippings and related materials on Peroutka's passing,
If I Were Born Again, typescript of a play,
Šťastlivec Sulla, typescript of a play,
Reviews of Peroutka's books, by Jaroslav Dresler and by an unknown author,
Boje o dnešek, photocopy of Peroutka's book published in 1925
Tak nebo tak, photocopy of Peroutka's book published in 1947

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles by or about Peroutka and about Czechoslovak affairs in American émigré and Czechoslovak domestic press. Arranged generally in the original order.

did.unittitle: Rada svobodného Československa (The Council of Free Czechoslovakia) Documents,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, reports and other materials, also related to the Radio Free Europe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains reports, correspondence and related documents on current political events in Czechoslovakia, on the affairs within the Czechoslovak desk, and on Peroutka's writings.

did.unittitle: RFE Kostrba Affair, a folder with correspondence and reports on tensions within the RFE Czechoslovak Desk,

unittitle.title: The Czecho-Slovak Problem: Answer to the Memorandum of Mr. Matus Cernak entitled "The Slovaks and Radio Free Europe,"
The Czechoslovak Problem and the Radio Free Europe: Reply to the Memorandum Submitted by the Slovak Liberation Committee,
Have Czech and Slovak Exiles Collaborated with Communism?: Second Part of the Answer to the Memorandum of the Slovak Liberation Committee,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains transcripts of Peroutka's weekly addresses, the so-called Sunday Talks or Weekly Talks, and their English translations, in typescript. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Odpověd Mr. C. D. Jacksonovi and its translation, Peroutka's speech: Special broadcast,
Radio Free Europe Broadcast Sound Recordings,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains Peroutka's play Šťastlivec Sulla, his weekly addresses, and other Radio Free Europe programs; 41 reels, transferred to digital files in June 2010. Arranged generally in the original order.
